website_summaries.verdict: Though you may need crampons with longer spikes for high-altitude climbing, these low-priced crampons are ideal for most users' needs, including hiking through snow and ice.
pros: Affordable, lightweight, and easy to use
Fits most men's and women's shoes
Has 18 spikes made of sturdy stainless steel
Holds up to wear in mud, ice, snow, and more
cons: Not for high-altitude climbing, but otherwise these crampons are a solid deal and fit most users' needs

customer_reviews.title: Should have purchased these years ago!
customer_reviews.text: We enjoy winter hiking. There were times or trails that we often found too dangerous to hike due to ice. We purchased these ice cleats this past fall and have used them extensively this winter. These things stick to the slipperiest, hardest ice surfaces that we have come across including smooth frozen lakes / streams. They are easy to slip onto a hiking boot. We do notice that they can get slightly uncomfortable on long hikes over hard ice surfaces - a small inconvenience for slip free hiking on any slippery surface.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce W

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy- safe on the ice- does what they are supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: sturdy- fits my womens size 8.5 gym shoes and sz 9 boots! I feel so much safer walking my dog at night when its so icy out! I live in Lone tree colorado- these work great and they are mostly easy to put on and take off. what you would expect on putting crampons on your shoes! buying more for friends and family :)- UPDATE- we just had a major ice storm here in CO- took these out for a LONG walk and WOW these work amazing!!! They did not even clot with snow! and once I got to the store I slipped off the crampons with ease! I LOVE these!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Fishingstars

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband for Christmas. He finally got to use them and loves them! Great traction and he said he slipped more the few steps in the driveway in his regular shoes than he did in these the whole day on the ice. A good value to see if buying an actual pair of cleat boots sometime is a good investment. Very accurate sizing on the listing.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Frooman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for snow,ice and mud
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I am an avid trail runner. I run on some aggressive trails that in the winter can be hard pack snow or ice and then in the spring, lots of mud. These stay on my shoes securely were others have fallen off or did not provide any traction. I wear a size ten trail shoe with a thick sole and the extra large Ravifun crampons fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Brucks

customer_reviews.title: stay upright, get these
customer_reviews.text: I had these before and I lent them and ??. Being q senior who does not have broken bones on my bucket list I ordered a new set. The midwest creates some awesome ice storms. These keep me safe. I chose this time to dedicate one pair of shoes for these and just take another pair of shoes for inside. Our weatherman shoed these in his be safety clip
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Issues with design
customer_reviews.text: Price was right but were too short even when ordering the large. The rear cleat was more than half way past the edge of the defined heel and it was obvious it would bend in short order. Prompt refund and the hunt continues.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Moritz

customer_reviews.title: Best crampons for icy conditions!
customer_reviews.text: We live in a very steep hilly area. Hiking post-winter/early spring is quite precarious because of all the ice. Our firemen highly recommend this type of a cramp on. I was able to keep my balance and walk easily even on the icy shores up in Door County along the cliffs following a severe ice storm.
customer_reviews.author: Diva diver

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: I use these for working in a very steep, very soft dirt canyon on our property. They stay in place and really grip the hillside. Sturdy material will fit my wife’s little boots yet stretch to fit my size 13 wide boots with no fear of breaking
customer_reviews.author: B. McConn

customer_reviews.title: So in deep snow I might recommend zip ties or paracord to help keep the top ...
customer_reviews.text: the velcro straps tend to come off when you dig your feet down into the snow. So in deep snow I might recommend zip ties or paracord to help keep the top together on your shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Gear Maniac!

customer_reviews.title: Broke on First Wear
customer_reviews.text: I went hiking with some friends on some Icy mountains in NH. This was the first use of these spikes. The Good: One of the spikes worked fantastic-great traction and lightweight. 10/10 would recommend. I actually was laughing because the traction was so good. The bad: The other one had one link broken when I took it out of the box. By the end of a 6 mile hike, three other links were broken. This was on the first go. I had to take the spikes off because they were catching my shoelaces and it was actively dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: M. B. Staben

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time packaged well. I wear a size 5 in women’s and the medium fits just fine on my chunky winter boots, and can even get them to fit snug on smaller fashion boots using Velcro straps that came included. They are super user-friendly and go on and off easily. They are beasts on thick slick ice, highly recommend. I already bought a pair for my mother and best friend
customer_reviews.author: Rachel H.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have fallen a few times. Once the ambulance took me to the hospital. They work so well that I am not afraid to walk on ice or in the snow now..
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit Traction Cleats Without Snow
customer_reviews.text: Traction Cleats fits great over my shoes. I haven't tried them on the ice and snow yet.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron W.

customer_reviews.title: well made, has not snowed since purchased
customer_reviews.text: these seem to be well made. However it has not snowed since they were purchased, so cannot advise on their usefulness.
customer_reviews.author: JFab

customer_reviews.title: Easy to wear
customer_reviews.text: Just what was needed for walking on icy trails in Maine.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Starkey

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Does the trick, never fell once and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Women's 8, get medium
customer_reviews.text: The spikes work great, BUT if you are a women's 8, DO NOT GET THE LARGE. I am giving them away to friend or family, as they fell off a few times hiking. The mediums should work well. The spikes themselves are good. I hope they change the size suggestion.
customer_reviews.author: Rose T~

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I bought the largest size to fit ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I bought the largest size to fit over my size 10 1600 gram thinsulate rubber boots. A struggle to get them on and off but they work great overall.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Massie

customer_reviews.title: Poor.
customer_reviews.text: Not a good experience thus far. I bought the L ( I'm a 9 which is indicated as a Large). It's loose. The metal frame in the front of the right crampon bend after a brief walk : I weight 158 so it's not from excessive weight. The rear right crampon kept rattling as I walked. I tried every way to get them to adjust properly but no results. The velcro strap I applied as indicated: no results. A waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: jon DiBenedetto

customer_reviews.title: I ran into ice along the trail and easily hiked on through without falling
customer_reviews.text: These ice cleats got me through a big hike in the Rockies. I ran into ice along the trail and easily hiked on through without falling. They fit nicely over any of my boot choices. Price fair
customer_reviews.author: brenda

customer_reviews.title: This is one instance where you get more than you paid for perfect for icefishing
customer_reviews.text: This is one instance where you get more than you paid for perfect for icefishing
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Mcallister

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cleats
customer_reviews.text: Used these in Iceland and my guide was envious. Easy on and off, flexible for different footwear, durable, really grips better than the ones with coils.
customer_reviews.author: Congelina

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: Used them in snow and ice, the rubber band got to loose compared to other cleats that I have had so they easily fell off especilly in the snow. Often you don't have to use the strap over the shoes if the rubber band is better but in this case you have to use the straps that come with the cleats. If just walking on ice I think they are better.
customer_reviews.author: Greta Maria

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: These work great, no more slipping on ice. Easy to put on over your shoes. I would buy them again and highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Kim H

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They work good on ice but are too much for just slippery roads
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty amazing. They saved my life this icy winter
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty amazing. They saved my life this icy winter!! My driveway was a skating rink, but these spikes were perfect. No slipping!
customer_reviews.author: Bryannah Ogletree

customer_reviews.title: Great on ice
customer_reviews.text: Tested them out on the Appalachian Trail this weekend. Great on ice, couldn’t slip if I tried (and I did), light weight, east to carry, easy to put on. No complaints at all. Can’t wait to get back on the ice
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome traction and CHEAP!
customer_reviews.text: Great price point for an even better product! Just used these to do a challenging winter mountaineering hike. Fit well (true to size description) and gave excellent traction on icy trails and rock scrambles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Saved us when we ran into an icy patch on our hike. Easy to put on and use.
customer_reviews.author: Rothschild

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Can hardly wait to get enough snow to use them! They attached on my boots very well.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Pannell

customer_reviews.title: They worked good, but the rubber will probably deteriorate fairly quickly
customer_reviews.text: I used them on a steep dirt slope to keep from falling while I cut weeds. They worked good, but the rubber will probably deteriorate fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Don T.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have lots of ice on my property, these are so very helpful!
customer_reviews.author: e califano

customer_reviews.title: Poor product.
customer_reviews.text: Did not strap around the boot as shown. Kept falling off. Difficult to walk on.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Antoniotti Jr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These worked well as advertised. I could have sized up one size.
customer_reviews.author: dgb1023

customer_reviews.title: Don't slip on ice
customer_reviews.text: They dig right into the ice. Very stable. Fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Norbert Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought these! The women's mediums fit perfectly over my size 8 snow boots. I have slipped so many times in ice and snow, and these have definitely helped to remedy that problem. Not to mention the fact that they make for a pretty good workout for the legs too. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Carryl Robison

customer_reviews.title: ... use walking on ice i think they would be fine in snow
customer_reviews.text: Broke during first use walking on ice i think they would be fine in snow.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Swender

customer_reviews.title: These got me up the icefall, but a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: These got me up the icefall, but a couple of tines got bent walking across the road back to the car.
customer_reviews.author: plumbing nemesis

customer_reviews.title: Best non-technical crampons I've used
customer_reviews.text: Good quality crampons for the price. Cleats fit as described, I wear US 12.5 and the XL fit great. The velcro strap makes a huge difference keeping them from shifting around on your foot. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dilettante

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 pairs and we loved them. My only complaint is that mine kept slipping out of place and it was kindof annoying. All in all these are great for hiking in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Kortnie Burr

customer_reviews.title: They work good they probably won't last forever but I've walked about ...
customer_reviews.text: They work good they probably won't last forever but I've walked about 10 miles in them so far with no issues so for the price you really can't go wrong
customer_reviews.author: Amanda P

customer_reviews.title: I really do love the traction they give me when hiking in the ...
customer_reviews.text: They fit my size 9 men's boots perfectly. I really do love the traction they give me when hiking in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Spikes work great on ice but bend easily when traversing rock
customer_reviews.author: Malachi Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They fall off, but my boots are probably too big
customer_reviews.author: Bob C

customer_reviews.title: Not to size
customer_reviews.text: This needs to be xL. To fit size 9 boots
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte keeling

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on and worked great on the ice.
customer_reviews.author: J P

customer_reviews.title: All grip no slip
customer_reviews.text: Great for ice fishing . Cleats are almost too rugged for trail use
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: These were nice to have on the way up
customer_reviews.text: These were nice to have on the way up. Having never used them before I got the recommended size for me but the heel spikes didn't line up with my heels. They were about an inch to an inch and a half shy of being directly under heel. Sometime on the way down they fell off my feet without me noticing. I didn't know that I needed to remove them for glissading, having never done it before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if you plan on hiking
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a winter hike in the Adirondacks on snow, ice and some exposed rock. I read the reviews and was convinced to buy them. After less than a mile they were falling apart. By 5 miles I was fully frustrated and Took them off. They were falling apart and most of the spikes were bent flat. I don’t write reviews often but these were terrible.
customer_reviews.author: mark schulz

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use on an upcoming hiking trip to Colorado. Wore them to test them out this past weekend and they broke. The rubber split after my hike therefore releasing the metal spike contraption. They no longer work and are of no use. I now leave in less than a week and I am out a pair of spikes.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 10 so I ordered (L) the item that arrived will barely fit my summer running shoes there is no chance of it fitting my winter boots.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Phillips

customer_reviews.title: But I recommend trying a different brand
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart in 2 places the first minute I used them and unable to repair with pliers. The links just aren't closed tightly enough. I wanted these because had more spikes than other brands. But I recommend trying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: M. T.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a surprise gift for my husband's ice fishing trip... however they didn't fit his boots.
customer_reviews.author: JuneBride

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy -- they break far too easily
customer_reviews.text: They broke within a month, good now only for the trashcan. The rubber that binds the metal links rips too easily. I used them only in my fields, walking the dogs. There was no reason for the breakage. I probably used them less than a dozen times.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Kellam

customer_reviews.title: Weak strap and inexact sizes
customer_reviews.text: The cleats and rubber are good quality, but the velcro strap broke halfway through my first hike wearing these. The L was much too large for my shoes (women's size 9.5 hiking shoes) - probably needed to differentiate the sizes between hiking shoes versus heavy boots. With the strap broken, the cleats sagged and hung very loose. Had to readjust them every five minutes or so. Very frustrating during a hike. I got a second pair for a friend but after the strap broke neither of us felt comfortable trusting these on another trek.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: After wearing this once, the front hook opened up and nearly made me fall because it caught my pant bottom. probably will not purchase this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: These ice cleats broke the second time they were put on the boots because the plastic came apart.
customer_reviews.author: paige birkel

customer_reviews.title: They worked great the first two times I used them
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for these. They worked great the first two times I used them. They broke on the third use. I contacted Ravifun and I did not receive a reply. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold up for a month
customer_reviews.text: Not a good product. The metal eyelet where chain attaches broke on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Broke first use
customer_reviews.text: Mine broke, rubber loop holding chains on ripped first use. Less than 3 miles into hike. My husbands broke second use.
customer_reviews.author: N.

product_meta.title: Ravifun Crampons Ice Cleats Traction Snow Grips for Women Men Kids Boots Anti Slip 18 Teeth Stainless Steel Spikes for Winter Walking Hiking Climbing Jogging Mountaineering
feature_bullets: The 18 teeth ice crampons are made of high quality stainless steel cleats, thicker and stronger to makes it never bend and safe for outdoor activity. Th spike-and-chain system which provides excellent traction on a variety of ice surfaces or other worst conditions.

Hard plastic tape into a super elastic rubber band ensures a tight hold on your shoe,keep you safe and injury-free. 12cm+12cm, flexible and extensible, suitable for all kinds of footwear, such as hiking shoes, and mountain boots, sports shoes, etc.

Very simple to use this ice cleats, buckle in the shoes, the front has a hook, the laces tied to the hook is very strong. Easy to adjust the degree of tightness, comfortable and stays in place. Two straps make sure the ice crampons more tighter and safer.

Suitable for outdoor four seasons essential. Reduce the risk of injury from slips and falls when walk on ice, snow, mud and wet grass or other poor conditions. Perfect for not only outdoor walking, climbing, hiking, ice fishing,etc., but also for the use of snow and ice in the city, especially for the elderly children snow slide out of season to use.

Small size, light weight, about 345g/pair. Come in a pouch for easy carry. Can be put it in a small storage bag and even pockets. The package includes 1 pair of Crampons, 1 pair of Velcro Straps and 1 piece of carry Bag.
